system_property_lookups: IWbemServices::ExecQuery - Root\Microsoft\Windows\TaskScheduler : SELECT * FROM MSFT_ScheduledTask  WHERE ((TaskName LIKE 'zServicekhiem2'))

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects TOKEN OBFUSCATION technique from Invoke-Obfuscation
Detects suspicious powershell process starts with base64 encoded commands (e.g. Emotet)
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Markus Neis, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Anton Kutepov, oscd.community

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects PowerShell command line patterns in combincation with encoded commands that often appear in malware infection chains
Detect the creation of a service with a service binary located in a suspicious directory
Detects UTF-8 and UTF-16 Base64 encoded powershell 'Invoke-' calls
Detects usage of a base64 encoded "FromBase64String" cmdlet in a process command line
Detects creation of a local user via PowerShell

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Change PowerShell Policies to an Insecure Level
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects changing the PowerShell script execution policy to a potentially insecure level using the "-ExecutionPolicy" flag.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets - ScriptBlock
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via PowerShell scriptblock logs
Detects usage of "Reflection.Assembly" load functions to dynamically load assemblies in memory

Adversaries may manipulate accounts to maintain access to victim systems.
Account manipulation may consist of any action that preserves adversary access to a compromised account, such as modifying credentials or permission groups
Detects modifications to the Windows Defender configuration settings using PowerShell to add exclusions

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Execution of Powershell with Base64
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Commandline to launch powershell with a base64 payload
Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.
Detects local user creation on Windows servers, which shouldn't happen in an Active Directory environment. Apply this Sigma Use Case on your Windows server logs and not on your DC logs.
Detects a PowerShell process that initiates network connections. Check for suspicious target ports and target systems.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: A Member Was Added to a Security-Enabled Global Group
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects activity when a member is added to a security-enabled global group

children.name: C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe cmd.exe /c start /min "" powershell.exe -WindowStyle hidden -NoLogo -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy bypass -EncodedCommand 
C:\Windows\System32\netsh.exe netsh advfirewall firewall add rule name="Remote Desktop" dir=in protocol=tcp localport=3389 profile=any action=allow
C:\Windows\System32\netsh.exe netsh advfirewall firewall add rule name="Remote Desktop" dir=in protocol=udp localport=3389 profile=any action=allow
C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe cmd.exe" /c sc delete "myRdpService" & SC CREATE "myRdpService" binpath= "C:\Windows\Temp\myRdpService.exe khiem2" start= auto & net start "myRdpService
C:\Windows\System32\sc.exe SC  CREATE "myRdpService" binpath= "C:\Windows\Temp\myRdpService.exe khiem2" start= auto

ids_alerts.rule_raw: alert ( gid:119; sid:279; rev:1; msg:"(http_inspect) invalid status line"; metadata: rule-type preproc; classtype:unknown;)

alert ip $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"INDICATOR-SHELLCODE x86 NOOP"; content:"|90 90 90 90 90 90 90 90 90 90 90 90 90 90|",fast_pattern,nocase; metadata:policy max-detect-ips drop,ruleset community; classtype:shellcode-detect; sid:648; rev:18; )

ids_alerts.rule_msg: POLICY-OTHER HTTP request by IPv4 address attempt
ids_alerts.rule_raw: alert tcp any any -> any $HTTP_PORTS ( msg:"POLICY-OTHER HTTP request by IPv4 address attempt"; flow:to_server,established; http_header; content:"Host:",fast_pattern,nocase; pcre:"/^Host\x3a\s*(?:(?:25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9]?[0-9])\.){3}(?:25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9]?[0-9])\s*:?\s*\d*\s*$/ims"; service:http; reference:url,www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec15.html; classtype:policy-violation; sid:50447; rev:1; )
alert ( gid:119; sid:281; rev:1; msg:"(http_inspect) invalid request line"; metadata: rule-type preproc; classtype:unknown;)

ids_alerts.rule_msg: ET HUNTING SUSPICIOUS Firesale gTLD EXE DL with no Referer June 13 2016
ids_alerts.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET HUNTING SUSPICIOUS Firesale gTLD EXE DL with no Referer June 13 2016"; flow:established,to_server; http.uri; content:".exe"; nocase; fast_pattern; http.host; pcre:"/\.(?:s(?:(?:(?:cien|pa)c|it)e|tream)|c(?:l(?:ick|ub)|ountry|ricket)|m(?:(?:aiso|e)n|o(?:bi|m))|p(?:r(?:ess|o)|arty|ink|w)|r(?:e(?:[dn]|view)|acing)|w(?:eb(?:site|cam)|in)|b(?:(?:outiq|l)ue|id)|d(?:ownload|ate|esi)|(?:accountan|hos)t|l(?:o(?:an|l)|ink)|t(?:rade|ech|op)|v(?:oyage|ip)|g(?:dn|b)|online|faith|kim|xyz)(?:\x3a\d{1,5})?$/"; http.header_names; content:!"Referer"; content:!"Cookie"; classtype:trojan-activity; sid:2022896; rev:6; metadata:created_at 2016_06_14, former_category CURRENT_EVENTS, updated_at 2020_08_17;)

ids_alerts.rule_msg: ET MALWARE LNK/imageres CnC Payload Request (GET)
ids_alerts.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET MALWARE LNK/imageres CnC Payload Request (GET)"; flow:established,to_server; urilen:<30; http.method; content:"GET"; http.uri; content:"/file/t/"; startswith; fast_pattern; content:".exe"; endswith; http.header_names; content:"|0d 0a|Host|0d 0a|Connection|0d 0a 0d 0a|"; bsize:22; http.connection; content:"Keep-Alive"; bsize:10; reference:md5,105771e5392260bd10473b370322f106; reference:url,twitter.com/StopMalvertisin/status/1723310413541220372; classtype:trojan-activity; sid:2049285; rev:1; metadata:affected_product Windows_XP_Vista_7_8_10_Server_32_64_Bit, attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2023_11_22, deployment Perimeter, former_category MALWARE, confidence Medium, signature_severity Major, updated_at 2023_11_22;)

ids_alerts.rule_msg: ET MALWARE Ducktail APT Style Payload Request
ids_alerts.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET MALWARE Ducktail APT Style Payload Request"; flow:established,to_server; http.method; content:"GET"; http.uri; content:"/file/t/"; startswith; fast_pattern; content:".exe"; endswith; http.header_names; content:"|0d 0a|Host|0d 0a|Connection|0d 0a 0d 0a|"; bsize:22; http.connection; content:"Keep-Alive"; bsize:10; reference:url,twitter.com/suyog41/status/1742462453559222731; classtype:trojan-activity; sid:2049901; rev:1; metadata:affected_product Windows_XP_Vista_7_8_10_Server_32_64_Bit, attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2024_01_03, deployment Perimeter, former_category MALWARE, malware_family Ducktail, confidence Medium, signature_severity Major, updated_at 2024_01_03;)

ids_alerts.rule_msg: ET INFO Executable Retrieved With Minimal HTTP Headers - Potential Second Stage Download
ids_alerts.rule_raw: alert http $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"ET INFO Executable Retrieved With Minimal HTTP Headers - Potential Second Stage Download"; flowbits:isset,min.gethttp; flow:established,to_client; file_data; content:"MZ"; within:2; content:"PE|00 00|"; distance:0; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2016538; rev:3; metadata:created_at 2013_03_06, updated_at 2019_07_26;)

alert http $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"ET POLICY RDP Wrapper Download (ini)"; flow:established,to_client; file.data; content:"|3b| RDP Wrapper Library configuration"; fast_pattern; content:"LogFile=|5c|rdpwrap.txt"; reference:url,github.com/asmtron/rdpwrap; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2032881; rev:1; metadata:attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2021_04_27, deployment Perimeter, deployment SSLDecrypt, former_category POLICY, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2021_04_27;)

ids_alerts.rule_msg: ET INFO Executable Download from dotted-quad Host
ids_alerts.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET INFO Executable Download from dotted-quad Host"; flow:established,to_server; http.uri; content:".exe"; endswith; nocase; http.host; content:"."; offset:1; depth:3; content:"."; within:4; content:"."; within:4; pcre:"/^(?:\d{1,3}\.){3}\d{1,3}$/"; http.request_line; content:".exe HTTP/1."; fast_pattern; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2016141; rev:8; metadata:attack_target Client_and_Server, created_at 2013_01_03, deployment Perimeter, former_category INFO, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2023_04_20;)

ids_alerts.rule_msg: ET HUNTING SUSPICIOUS Dotted Quad Host MZ Response
ids_alerts.rule_raw: alert http $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"ET HUNTING SUSPICIOUS Dotted Quad Host MZ Response"; flow:established,to_client; flowbits:isset,http.dottedquadhost; file_data; content:"MZ"; within:2; content:"PE|00 00|"; distance:0; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2021076; rev:2; metadata:created_at 2015_05_08, former_category INFO, updated_at 2019_07_26;)
